name: Mindersand
tagline: The powder that makes people easier to steer.
overview: A fine, pale powder traded under respectable names: drying powder, preservative, anti-caking agent. In truth, it's contraband because of what it does when it enters the food chain.

appearance.texture: Silky between the fingers; it 'floats' slightly when poured
appearance.tell: A faint bitter-metal wrongness behind an otherwise ordinary flavor

disguises.name: Shipboard spices
disguises.description: Pepper tins, dried herb mixes, bulk stores

effects.symptoms: Brain-fog, mild tremor, 'bad sleep' that doesn't match hours rested
Flattened urgency, slowed reactions, dulled edge of anger or alarm, compliance shaped like fatigue
Some bodies reject it violently (anaphylaxis-like reactions). Rarer, louder, harder to explain away.

whyItWorks: Victims miss a half-step at the wrong time
Bad deals get accepted because resisting feels like 'too much work'
targetingNote: Smith's Coster's own people stay sharp; everyone else gets fog. They don't dose their own crews. They dose the dock population that might notice, organize, or compete.

whySmithsCoster.detail: A tired dock population misses patterns, organizes slowly, and accepts the status quo. Independent workers and small captains become less likely to ask questions.
Foggy judgment on other crews turns into miscounted crates, 'nobody saw it' arguments, and convenient blame. The cost lands on competitors.
A blade makes enemies quickly. A 'bad batch' makes people doubt themselves. It's coercion that can be explained away.

distribution: Moves through warehouse stamps and lot marks that look legitimate
Travels in sealed crates at night, reappears as 'ordinary stock' by morning
Paperwork rarely names it plainly; shows up as coded additive entries

detection.prevention: Keep supplies sealed, track origins, avoid 'mystery' repacking
detection.confirmation: Look for the bitter-metal tell, check seams and reseated lids, follow the pattern: who drank what, when, and who started shaking afterward
detection.mistake: Treating it like a one-time poison. It's a system poison.

adventureHooks.name: The 'bad batch' contract
adventureHooks.hook: A captain hires the crew after two near-miss disasters and swears it's 'just fatigue.'

adventureHooks.name: The pattern emerges
adventureHooks.hook: A crew member develops tremors and brain-fog. When the party traces their recent meals, the same supplier name keeps appearing.

adventureHooks.name: The silent advantage
